answer: A: To illustrate how the marine reservoir effect can cause modern marine organisms to appear much older in radiocarbon dating.

The example of a "freshly killed seal carbon dated as 1,300 years old" is used to demonstrate the concept of the marine reservoir effect. This effect occurs when marine organisms, like seals, have a different carbon-14 concentration compared to terrestrial organisms due to their diet and environment. As a result, their carbon-14 content is lower than expected, leading to a younger apparent age when carbon-dated. The speaker uses this example to explain this phenomenon rather than to argue against radiocarbon dating or to present new experimental data.
